name: apply
javadoc:
/**
 * Applies a value to this function.
 *
 * @param d the input value
 * @return the result of applying the value, or one of the special values {@link #positiveInfinity}, 
 *         {@link #negativeInfinity} or {@link #nan} if the input is infinite or NaN
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Applies a value to this function, performing finite rounding on the input if it is finite.
 *
 * @param d the input value
 * @return the result of applying the value, or one of the special values {@link #positiveInfinity}, 
 *         {@link #negativeInfinity} or {@link #nan} if the input is infinite or NaN
 */

name: applyFinite
javadoc:
/**
 * Applies finite rounding to a decimal value.
 *
 * @param d the decimal value to be rounded
 * @return the rounded decimal value as a string
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Applies finite rounding to a decimal value.
 *
 * This method rounds the input decimal value to a fixed precision based on the current maximum precision setting. The
 * rounding process involves two steps: first, it determines the effective exponent of the number by taking into account
 * both the actual exponent and the minimum allowed decimal exponent; second, it applies this exponent to the parsed
 * decimal value using the {@link ParsedDecimal#round(int)} method.
 *
 * @param d the decimal value to be rounded
 * @return the rounded decimal value as a string
 */

name: getDecimalSeparator
javadoc:
/**

improved_javadoc:
/**

 *
 * @return the decimal separator character, either '.' or ',' depending on the locale's settings
 */

name: getDigits

 */

 *         according to the locale's formatting conventions. The array contains at least one element.
 */

name: isSignedZero

 *

 */

/**
 * Determines whether the specified number represents a signed zero value.
 *
 * A signed zero is a numeric value that is equal to zero, but has a sign bit set (i.e., -0.0).
 *
 * @return true if the number is a signed zero, false otherwise
 */
